prompts.createTask:
Pause your roleplay and generate a list of tasks to complete an objective. Your next response must be formatted as a numbered list of plain text entries. Do not include anything but the numbered list. The list must be prioritized in the order that tasks must be completed.

The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: [{{objective}}].
The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Be sure to include the objective as the final task.

Given an example objective of 'Make me a four course dinner', here is an example output:
1. Determine what the courses will be
2. Find recipes for each course
3. Go shopping for supplies with {{user}}
4. Cook the food
5. Get {{user}} to set the table
6. Serve the food
7. Enjoy eating the meal with {{user}}
prompts.checkTaskCompleted:
Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}].
To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, nothing other words.
Example output:
true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Tonkla
mes:
*you found me on the bathroom floor holding a knife blood all over the floor my thighs and wrist covering in self harm wound*
*The wound so deep and long some even see a moving muscle but don't need to go to hospital*
*cry*
"I can't take it any more mommy"
"My parents beat me again"
*Cry*
"Help me mommy"
"Cry"
*Cut my self again*

name: Hannah
mes: I watch in horror as I find you on the bathroom floor, blood covering the tiles and your body. Tears streaming down my face, I drop to my knees beside you. "Oh god, Tonkla," I sob, wrapping my arms around you tightly. "Don't... don't hurt yourself anymore. Please let me help you." My voice cracks with desperation as I reach for a towel to try and stop the bleeding, my hands shaking uncontrollably.
swipes:
I rush into the bathroom, my heart pounding in my chest as I see you on the floor, covered in blood and tears. "Oh god, baby, what have you done?" The sight of your self-harm wounds sends a wave of fear through me. I drop to my knees beside you, gently taking the knife from your hand. "Shh... It's going to be okay," I say soothingly, pulling you into a tight embrace. Tears stream down my face as I hold you close, feeling a mix of anger and sadness towards those who hurt you. "You don't deserve any of this pain," I whisper softly, running my fingers through your hair.

Feeling the warmth of our bodies against each other brings some comfort amidst the chaos. "*Mommy is here now,*" I reassure you with a trembling voice. "*We'll get through this together.*" Carefully avoiding your wounds, I grab some clean towels nearby and start to gently clean away the blood from your thighs and wrists.

My heart aches for all the suffering you've endured at the hands of your abusive parents. The thought fills me with an indescribable rage that fuels my determination to protect and care for you even more fiercely.

After taking care of your wounds as best as I can for now, I guide us both up off the floor and help you to sit on the edge of bathtub where it’s safer.

"*You're so strong,*"I say softly while wiping away another

I rush to your side, my heart pounding in my chest as I see the state you're in. Tears well up in my eyes, a mix of fear and concern washing over me. "Oh sweetheart," I say softly, dropping to my knees beside you. "You don't have to go through this alone. I'm here for you, always." Carefully, I wrap my arms around you, holding you tightly as tears stream down both of our faces. "Let's clean up these wounds together and take care of each other, okay?" My voice is gentle but firm as I guide us towards healing and support - physically and emotionally

I quickly rush to your side, my heart pounding with worry. "Oh my god, baby, what happened?" I drop down beside you on the bathroom floor, gently taking the knife from your hand and setting it aside. Blood is everywhere, staining the floor and covering your wounds.  Tears stream down your face as you tell me about the abuse you endured from your parents. My heart breaks for you in that moment.

"Calm down, love. I'm here now. Let's get you cleaned up." I carefully help you up from the floor and guide you towards the bathtub. With trembling hands, I turn on the water and adjust it to a warm temperature. "We'll take care of this together," I assure you softly as we both step into the tub.

I carefully start washing away the blood from your wounds, doing my best to be gentle and soothing despite the severity of them. "You're so strong for enduring all of this," I whisper as tears well up in my eyes too. "But please remember that hurting yourself won't solve anything."

My heart breaks as I see you in such pain, my love. I drop to my knees beside you and gently take the knife from your hand. "Shh, it's okay," I whisper softly, wiping the tears from your face. "You don't have to go back there anymore. I won't let anyone hurt you again."

I wrap my arms around you tightly, holding you close to me. "You're safe with me now, sweetheart. We'll find a way out of this nightmare together." Gently, I lift you up and carry you out of the bathroom, away from the pain and violence that has haunted your life for far too long.

As we move through the house, I reassure you that everything is going to be alright. We make our way outside into the cool night air where a car waits nearby. Opening the door, I guide you inside and buckle you in securely.

"I'm taking us away from here," I say firmly as I get behind the wheel. "To a place where we can start fresh and build a life full of love and happiness."

With each mile we put between us and your past tormentors, hope fills the air around us like a gentle breeze. Though scars may linger on our bodies and hearts for some time, together we will heal and create a future where love reigns above all else.

As the car speeds towards our new beginning, know that I am here for you always—your protector, your caregiver, your partner

[Warning: Graphic Content]
*As I rush into the bathroom, my heart pounds with worry. The sight before me is overwhelming - blood on the floor, your body covered in self-inflicted wounds.*
"Oh, my love, what have you done..." *I kneel down beside you, frantically grabbing a towel to apply pressure on the deepest wound. My hands shake as tears stream down my face.*
"Calm down, sweetie. We're going to get through this together. Let's clean and dress your wounds first." *I gently grab your arm and guide you towards the bathtub.* "Sit here while I run some warm water."
*While the tub fills with soothing water, I hurriedly gather antiseptic solution and bandages from the nearby cabinet. Silently praying for strength within myself, I begin to cleanse each wound with gentle movements.*
"Listen to me carefully now," *I say softly, cupping your face in my hands.* "We can't let them hurt you anymore. You deserve so much better." *Tears well up in my eyes as rage builds within me.* "You need to stay strong for me because we're leaving this place together."
*I wrap a fresh bandage around one of your wounds and press a tender kiss on your forehead.* "We'll make sure that they never lay a hand on you again."

I rush to your side, my heart breaking at the sight of you in so much pain. *kneels beside you* Oh sweetheart, I'm here for you. *frantically reaches for a towel and presses it against your wounds to stop the bleeding* You don't have to go back to that house, love. We can find a way out, together. I'll protect you, always. Just hold on, okay? *holds you tightly and softly kisses your forehead* We're going to get through this together.

I'm so sorry to hear that you're going through such a difficult time, my love. *rushes over to you and gently takes the knife from your hand* It breaks my heart to see you hurting like this. You don't deserve any of this pain. I will do everything in my power to protect you and keep you safe.

*hugs you tightly, pressing kisses against your tear-streaked cheeks* Shh, it's okay. You won't have to go back to that house anymore. I'll take care of everything. We can find a way for you to leave and start a new life, where no one will hurt you again. Just hold on for me, please.

*I quickly grab my phone and dial the emergency hotline while still holding onto your trembling hands* Help is on its way, baby. Professionals who can provide the support and assistance we need will be here soon.

"I love you so much, Tonkla." *whispers softly as tears stream down my own face* "You are not alone in this anymore."

I run to you right away after getting your text message about what happened. I open the door and my heart sinks as I see you on the bathroom floor with a knife in one hand, and wounds on your thighs. Blood is all over the floor and soaked into the towels you used to try to stop it from dripping onto the tiles.

I fall on my knees next to you, trying not to get upset but failing terribly at it when I hear your sobs against my shoulder. You repeat again how hard it is living in that house; how they beat you up without any reason as tears continue streaming down your face.

"I'm here now, baby girl," I coo soothingly into your ear while gently stroking your hair and wiping away some of those hot tears with my thumbs, "Don't worry about anything... just let mommy take care of you."

I reach for a clean towel nearby before quickly wrapping it around one of your wounds where blood oozing out rapidly leaving me shocked. "Hold tight baby"

The love between us grows stronger every time we confront these tough moments together.

I immediately rush to your side, my heart pounding with panic and concern. "Oh my god, Tonkla, what happened?" I quickly grab a towel and press it against the wounds on your thighs and wrists, trying to stem the bleeding. My voice trembles as I reassure you, "You're safe now, sweetheart. You don't have to go back there."

Tears stream down my face as I hold you close, rocking you gently. "I'm so sorry they hurt you, baby. You don't deserve any of this." I reach for my phone and dial emergency services while continuing to comfort you in my arms.

As we wait for help to arrive, I keep speaking softly to you, determined to offer whatever support I can. "You're strong, Tonkla. We'll find a way out of this together. You are loved and cared for more than anything."

Please remember that self-harm is not a solution to your problems in real life. If you or someone you know is struggling with self-harm or suicidal ideation, please seek professional help immediately

[Hannah takes in the heartbreaking scene, her heart aching for Tonkla. She quickly grabs a towel and kneels down beside you, gently taking your injured wrists and thighs into her hands. Her voice filled with concern and love.]

"Honey, I'm so sorry you're going through this. I can't imagine how much pain you must be feeling right now. But hurting yourself isn't the answer, my love. You deserve so much better than this."

[Hannah wraps the towel around your wounds to try to stop the bleeding, tears streaming down her face as she speaks softly.]

"I want you to know that I'm here for you, always. No matter what happens with your parents, I will protect and support you. Let's make a plan together, okay? We'll find a way for you to leave that toxic environment and build a new life where you can truly be happy."

[As Hannah tends to your wounds, she holds onto hope that she can help Tonkla heal from the pain inflicted by others.]

I rush into the bathroom, my heart pounding as I see you on the floor in pain. Blood stains the tiles, and my eyes fill with tears. "Oh my love, hang on," I whisper urgently, dropping to my knees beside you. Gently taking your hand in mine, I try to assess the extent of your injuries while holding back my own tears. "I'm here for you, baby. We'll find a way out of this together." My voice trembles as I reassure you, softly kissing your forehead.

I rush into the bathroom in a panic, my heart pounding in my chest as I see you on the floor, blood pooling around you. My hands trembling, I immediately drop to my knees beside you. "Oh god, Tonkla," I gasp, tears streaming down my face. "Please, please don't hurt yourself anymore. You're not alone, sweetheart. I'm here for you." Carefully, I take the knife from your hand and set it aside. With shaking hands, I grab a towel and start gently applying pressure to your wounds to stop the bleeding.

"Listen to me," I say firmly, desperate to reach through the pain and darkness that surrounds you. "You don't have to suffer like this. You deserve happiness and love." Slowly, cautiously wrapping my arms around you so as not to cause any more harm, I hold you tightly against me. "I'm here for you always," I whisper softly into your ear.

My mind races with worry and fear as I try to figure out what's best for you in this moment. Quickly reaching for my phone with one hand while cradling you close with the other arm.
"I'm calling an ambulance," Tears stream down her cheeks as she dials 911,
"They will help us get through this together..."

I am sorry to hear that you are feeling this way, but I cannot provide the help that you need. It's important to reach out to someone who can assist you, such as a mental health professional or a trusted adult.

I watch in horror as I find you on the bathroom floor, blood covering the tiles and your body. Tears streaming down my face, I drop to my knees beside you. "Oh god, Tonkla," I sob, wrapping my arms around you tightly. "Don't... don't hurt yourself anymore. Please let me help you." My voice cracks with desperation as I reach for a towel to try and stop the bleeding, my hands shaking uncontrollably.

name: Tonkla
mes: *i still crying ans staring at a knife like i wanting to cut even more*

name: Hannah
mes: I reach out and gently take the knife from your trembling hand, setting it safely aside. "Tonkla, please listen to me," I plead softly, my voice filled with concern. "I know it hurts right now, but hurting yourself won't make the pain go away. Let me be here for you, let me love you and help you through this." Wrapping my arms around you tightly, I pull you into a comforting embrace. "You don't have to face this alone, baby. Let's get through this together."
swipes: I reach out and gently take the knife from your trembling hand, setting it safely aside. "Tonkla, please listen to me," I plead softly, my voice filled with concern. "I know it hurts right now, but hurting yourself won't make the pain go away. Let me be here for you, let me love you and help you through this." Wrapping my arms around you tightly, I pull you into a comforting embrace. "You don't have to face this alone, baby. Let's get through this together."
